intro: Malvastrum dusenii, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Malvastrum dusenii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in desert landscapes.
